description: What does it mean to be healthy/normal? How does disease impact us and society? We will follow the life of a human from health and normalcy, to abnormality and different stages of pathogenesis, which we have defined as prevention, diagnosis and treatment. Finally, we will discuss end of life care and decisions. All these are discussed in terms of individuals, society (community or governments) and the newest scientific breakthroughs, ultimately to reflect on the pertinent question of this seminar - on health, disease and the human condition.
title: Health and Disease
prerequisite: YCC1122 Quantitative Reasoning or with the permission of the instructor.
